name: Johann Sebastian Bach
description: A German composer and musician of the late Baroque period, known for the Brandenburg Concertos, Goldberg Variations, and Mass in B minor. Widely regarded as one of the greatest composers in the history of Western music.

name: Claude Monet
description: Founder of French Impressionism, celebrated for his landscape paintings and exploration of light and color.

name: Mao Zedong (毛澤東)
description: Founding father of the People's Republic of China, his rule was marked by radical policies and political campaigns.

name: John Calvin
description: Theologian whose writings established Calvinism and influenced Reformed theology.

name: Horatio Nelson
description: British admiral whose victories secured British naval dominance during the Napoleonic Wars.

name: Fibonacci
description: Popularized Hindu-Arabic numerals in Europe through Liber Abaci and introduced the Fibonacci sequence.

name: William Shakespeare
description: An English playwright, poet and actor. Widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language and the world's pre-eminent dramatist.

name: Charles Darwin
description: An English naturalist widely known for his contributions to evolutionary biology and the theory of natural selection.

name: Vincent van Gogh
description: Dutch post-impressionist painter whose emotionally charged works and bold color palettes have left a lasting legacy in art.

name: John Maynard Keynes
description: One of the most influential economists of modern times, founder of Keynesian economics.

name: Ludwig van Beethoven
description: A German composer and pianist, one of the most revered figures in the history of Western music spanning the Classical and Romantic eras.

name: Cao Xueqin (曹雪芹)
description: Author of Dream of the Red Chamber, a pinnacle of Qing-era vernacular fiction.

name: Al-Zarqali (Arzachel)
description: Designed the universal astrolabe and refined solar tables later used by Copernicus.

name: Fukuzawa Yukichi (福澤諭吉)
description: Writer and educator whose advocacy of Eastern ethics and Western technology shaped Japan's modernization and founded Keio University.

name: Peter the Great
description: Westernized and expanded Russia; founded Saint Petersburg.

name: Dmitry Donskoy (Дмитрий Донской)
description: Defeated the Mongols at Kulikovo, boosting Moscow's rise within Rus'.

name: Robert Boyle
description: Formulated Boyle's Law and advanced chemistry as an experimental science.

name: Tran Hung Dao (陳興道)
description: General who twice repelled massive Mongol invasions of Dai Viet.

name: Charles Dickens
description: Renowned English writer known for vivid depictions of Victorian society in works like Oliver Twist and A Christmas Carol.

name: Giovanni da Pian del Carpine
description: First papal envoy to reach Karakorum; earliest European eyewitness report of the Mongol Empire.

name: Kim Il-sung
description: Founding leader of North Korea, he established a rigid totalitarian regime with dynastic succession.

name: William of Ockham
description: Philosopher who formulated Ockham's Razor and challenged papal authority.

name: William the Conqueror
description: Duke of Normandy who won the Battle of Hastings (1066) and reshaped England with the Domesday survey.

name: Frederick I Barbarossa
description: Holy Roman Emperor who reasserted imperial authority in Germany and Italy and led the Third Crusade.

name: Aguda (金太祖阿骨打)
description: Founder of the Jin dynasty; his armies overthrew the Liao and captured North China.

name: Friedrich Nietzsche
description: Influential German philosopher whose works on morality, culture, and existentialism have shaped modern thought.

name: Geoffrey Chaucer
description: Wrote The Canterbury Tales, establishing Middle English as a major literary language.

name: Michael Faraday
description: English scientist known for groundbreaking work in electromagnetism and electrochemistry.

name: Ashikaga Yoshimitsu (足利義満)
description: Muromachi shogun who fostered trade with Ming China and built Kinkaku-ji.

name: Toyotomi Hideyoshi (豊臣秀吉)
description: Completed Japan's unification; land surveys, sword hunt, and invasions of Korea.

name: Jiaqing Emperor (嘉慶帝)
description: Tackled Heshen's corruption and suppressed the White Lotus Rebellion.

name: Pierre-Auguste Renoir
description: French Impressionist painter celebrated for his vibrant depictions of social life and luminous portraits.

name: John Adams
description: Second U.S. President and diplomat; key figure in the American Founding and early republican governance.

name: Askia Muhammad I
description: Reformed Songhai administration, promoted Islam, and expanded trans-Saharan trade routes.

name: Samuel de Champlain
description: Father of New France; founded Quebec and mapped the St. Lawrence Valley and Great Lakes.

name: Immanuel Kant
description: German philosopher; his Critique of Pure Reason profoundly shaped metaphysics and epistemology.

name: Zheng Chenggong (鄭成功)
description: Ming loyalist who expelled the Dutch from Taiwan and resisted Qing rule.

name: William of Rubruck
description: Franciscan explorer whose detailed Mongol travel account informed Roger Bacon and Marco Polo.

name: Benjamin Franklin
description: A Founding Father of the United States; scientist, inventor, diplomat, and statesman. Famous for experiments with electricity and helping draft the Declaration of Independence.

name: Yue Fei (岳飛)
description: National hero who led Southern Song armies against the Jurchen Jin invaders.

name: Li Qingzhao (李清照)
description: Greatest female poet of the Song dynasty; refined the ci lyric form.

name: Nizami Ganjavi
description: Author of the Khamsa epics, a model for Persian and Ottoman literature.

name: Xu Guangqi (徐光啟)
description: Scholar-official who introduced Western mathematics and astronomy with the Jesuits.

name: Wanli Emperor (萬曆帝)
description: Presided over late-Ming prosperity, followed by fiscal decline; withdrew from active governance.

name: Alauddin Khilji
description: Delhi sultan who repelled Mongol raids and reformed revenue and army pay systems.

name: Babur
description: Founded the Mughal Empire after victory at Panipat (1526).

name: Chiang Kai-shek (蔣介石)
description: Leader of the Republic of China who headed the Kuomintang during the Chinese Civil War and later governed Taiwan.

name: Saladin (صلاح الدين)
description: Re-united Egypt and Syria, defeated Crusaders at Hattin, and retook Jerusalem (1187).

name: Sultan Qutuz (قطز)
description: Commanded Mamluk forces to the first major Mongol defeat at Ain Jalut.

name: Frederick II (Hohenstaufen)
description: Holy Roman Emperor who blended Arabic and European science, founded Naples University, and led the Sixth Crusade.

name: Shunzhi Emperor (順治帝)
description: First Qing emperor to rule all China; began Sinicization of Manchu governance.

name: Antonie van Leeuwenhoek
description: Father of microbiology; first to observe bacteria and protozoa with early microscopes.

name: Aurangzeb
description: Last great Mughal emperor; expanded the empire to its largest extent.

name: Henry Hudson
description: Explored Arctic waters and the river/bay that bear his name, spurring Dutch and English claims.

name: Adolf Hitler
description: Leader of Nazi Germany, responsible for initiating World War II and orchestrating the Holocaust.

name: Empress Dowager Cixi (慈禧太后)
description: De facto ruler of late-Qing China; oversaw conservative resistance to and selective adoption of Western reforms.

name: Leonardo da Vinci
description: An Italian polymath of the High Renaissance active as a painter, draughtsman, engineer, scientist, theorist, sculptor, and architect.

name: Kim Jong-un
description: Current leader of North Korea, known for his strict authoritarian policies and nuclear ambitions.

name: John Milton
description: Author of Paradise Lost and advocate of free speech (Areopagitica).

name: Saigo Takamori (西郷隆盛)
description: One of the Three Great Nobles of the Meiji Restoration; led the Satsuma Rebellion in defense of samurai interests.

name: Jan Vermeer
description: Dutch painter revered for luminous interior scenes and subtle use of light.

name: Prince Henry the Navigator
description: Royal patron whose Atlantic and African expeditions inaugurated the European Age of Discovery.

name: Ji Yun (紀昀)
description: Scholar and chief editor of the vast imperial encyclopedia Siku Quanshu.

name: Christopher Columbus
description: His 1492 voyage linked Europe and the Americas, reshaping global trade and empire building.

name: Charles V
description: Ruled the Spanish Empire and Holy Roman Empire at their zenith.

name: Katsushika Hokusai (葛飾北斎)
description: Master ukiyo-e printmaker; his Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji transformed Japanese art.

name: Francis Drake
description: Led the first English circumnavigation and challenged Spanish naval dominance.

name: Thomas Aquinas
description: Summa Theologica fused Aristotelian philosophy with Christian theology; cornerstone of scholasticism.

name: Franz Liszt
description: Virtuoso Hungarian pianist and composer celebrated for his technical mastery and innovations in piano performance.

name: Johannes Gutenberg
description: Invented movable-type printing in Europe, revolutionizing the spread of information.

name: Zhu Xi (朱熹)
description: Systematized Neo-Confucianism; his commentaries became core Song civil-service texts.

name: Sejong the Great (世宗)
description: Joseon monarch who created Hangul script and fostered scientific innovation.

name: Michael VIII Palaiologos
description: Recaptured Constantinople in 1261, restoring Byzantine rule and prolonging Orthodox culture.

name: William Marshal
description: Legendary knight and regent who steered England through the Magna Carta crisis.

name: Henry II Plantagenet
description: Instituted common-law reforms and ruled a trans-Channel Angevin realm from Scotland to the Pyrenees.

name: Elizabeth I
description: Queen of England; defeat of the Spanish Armada and patronage of the Elizabethan cultural renaissance.

name: William Harvey
description: Demonstrated the circulation of blood and the heart's pumping action.

name: Joan of Arc
description: Teenage heroine whose leadership lifted the siege of Orleans and changed the course of the Hundred Years War.

name: George Washington
description: A Founding Father and the first president of the United States. As commander of the Continental Army, Washington led Patriot forces to victory in the American Revolutionary War.

name: Li Hongzhang (李鴻章)
description: Influential Qing diplomat and reformer, architect of the Self-Strengthening Movement and China's first modern foreign ministry.

name: Qianlong Emperor (乾隆皇帝)
description: Sixth Qing emperor; presided over a high-water mark of Qing prosperity and was a great patron of the arts.

name: Tokugawa Ieyasu (徳川家康)
description: Unified Japan and founded the Tokugawa shogunate, ushering in the Edo period.

name: Napoleon Bonaparte
description: A French general and statesman who led military campaigns across Europe during the Napoleonic Wars from 1796 to 1815.

name: Saddam Hussein
description: President of Iraq, his regime was characterized by oppressive control and regional conflicts.

name: Joseph Haydn
description: Austrian composer often called the Father of the Symphony and Father of the String Quartet.

name: Dante Alighieri
description: Author of The Divine Comedy, bridging medieval theology and Renaissance humanism.

name: Baybars (الظاهر بيبرس)
description: Mamluk sultan who halted Mongol advance at Ain Jalut and ended Crusader strongholds.

name: Vasco da Gama
description: Opened the sea route from Europe to India around the Cape of Good Hope.

name: Raphael
description: High-Renaissance master of painting and architecture.

name: Nasir al-Din al-Tusi
description: Astronomer-mathematician who modeled planetary motion and advanced trigonometry.

name: Ivan IV the Terrible
description: First Tsar of Russia; centralized authority and expanded into Siberia.

name: Louis XIV
description: The Sun King of France; epitome of absolute monarchy and long-lasting centralized rule.

name: Nader Shah
description: Conqueror who briefly restored Persian power from India to the Caucasus.

name: Osman I
description: Founder of the Ottoman dynasty, capturing Byzantine forts in Bithynia and carving a beylik from Byzantine frontiers.

name: Nurhaci (努爾哈赤)
description: Jurchen chieftain who laid the groundwork for the Qing dynasty.

name: Li Shizhen (李時珍)
description: Physician who compiled the monumental Compendium of Materia Medica.

name: Galileo Galilei
description: Performed telescopic observations, founded kinematics, and defended Copernicanism.

name: Milton Friedman
description: American economist who received the 1976 Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences. An intellectual leader of the Chicago school of economics.

name: Miguel de Cervantes
description: Author of Don Quixote, regarded as the foundation of the modern novel.

name: Sunni Ali
description: Conqueror who expanded Gao into West Africa's dominant Songhai Empire.

name: Lin Zexu (林則徐)
description: Imperial commissioner who led the campaign against opium in Canton - the catalyst for the First Opium War.

name: Caravaggio
description: Baroque painter famous for dramatic chiaroscuro realism.

name: Huizong (宋徽宗)
description: Artist-emperor whose cultural patronage peaked Song arts but whose reign ended with Jurchen conquest.

name: Le Loi (黎利)
description: Led the Lam Son uprising that expelled Ming occupation and founded the Later Le dynasty.

name: Okubo Toshimichi (大久保利通)
description: Key Meiji statesman; drove major political and economic reforms that modernized Japan after the fall of the shogunate.

name: Shah Abbas I
description: Safavid ruler who revitalized Persia and moved the capital to Isfahan.

name: Genghis Khan (成吉思汗)
description: Founder of the Mongol Empire, creating history's largest contiguous land empire and opening Eurasian trade routes.

name: Skanderbeg (Gjergj Kastrioti)
description: Led a 25-year rebellion that checked Ottoman expansion in the Balkans.

name: Marquis de Lafayette
description: French aristocrat who fought in both the American and French Revolutions, symbolizing Franco-American cooperation.

name: Kusunoki Masashige (楠木正成)
description: Loyalist commander famed for unconventional tactics during Japan's Kenmu Restoration.

name: Taira no Kiyomori (平清盛)
description: First samurai leader to dominate Kyoto court politics, paving the way for shogunal rule.

name: Zhang Juzheng (張居正)
description: Grand Secretary whose Single Whip tax reforms stabilized Ming finances.

name: Mark Twain
description: American writer and humorist known for his satirical wit and classics like Adventures of Huckleberry Finn.

name: Peter Paul Rubens
description: Flemish Baroque painter known for dynamic compositions and vibrant color.

name: James Watt
description: Dramatically improved the steam engine, catalyzing the Industrial Revolution.

name: Omar Khayyam
description: Re-calibrated the Jalali calendar; eminent mathematician and poet of the Rubaiyat.

name: Catherine the Great
description: Empress of Russia; expanded Russian territory and pursued Enlightenment-inspired reforms.

name: James Clerk Maxwell
description: Scottish physicist whose formulation of electromagnetic theory unified electricity, magnetism, and light.

name: Luo Guanzhong (羅貫中)
description: Credited author of Romance of the Three Kingdoms, one of China's Four Great Classical Novels.

name: Sakamoto Ryoma (坂本龍馬)
description: Visionary samurai who brokered the Satcho Alliance, paving the way for the Meiji Restoration.

name: Utagawa Hiroshige (歌川広重)
description: Pioneer of landscape prints in ukiyo-e; his Fifty-three Stations of the Tokaido series had widespread influence.

name: Li Zicheng (李自成)
description: Peasant rebel leader whose uprising toppled the Ming but soon collapsed.

name: Richard I the Lionheart
description: Crusader king famed for campaigns against Saladin during the Third Crusade.

name: Augusto Pinochet
description: Military dictator who ruled Chile with a repressive regime following a coup d'etat.

name: Alexander Graham Bell
description: Inventor of the telephone, innovator in communication technologies.

name: Sun Yat-sen (孫中山)
description: Revolutionary and Father of the Republic; led the 1911 Revolution that overthrew the Qing dynasty.

name: Vlad III Dracula
description: Prince of Wallachia famed for guerrilla resistance and brutal tactics against the Ottomans.

name: Wu Sangui (吳三桂)
description: General who opened Shanhai Pass to the Manchus and later led the Revolt of the Three Feudatories.

name: Titian
description: Venetian master renowned for color and portraiture.

name: Yongle Emperor (明永樂帝)
description: Ming emperor who sponsored Zheng He's voyages and built Beijing's Forbidden City.

name: Niccolo Machiavelli
description: Author of The Prince, defining modern political realism and statecraft.

name: Ulugh Beg
description: Timurid astronomer-king who built Samarkand observatory and produced highly accurate star catalogues.

name: Blaise Pascal
description: Advanced probability theory, devised Pascal's Triangle, and built a mechanical calculator.

name: Gaozong of Song (南宋高宗)
description: Re-established the Song court in Hangzhou after the Jingkang Disaster and negotiated peace with Jin.

name: Zheng He (鄭和)
description: Led seven Ming treasure-fleet voyages across the Indian Ocean, projecting Chinese maritime power.

name: Michelangelo Buonarroti
description: An Italian sculptor, painter, architect, and poet of the High Renaissance with lasting influence on Western art.

name: Chongzhen Emperor (崇禎帝)
description: Last Ming ruler; committed suicide as Li Zicheng's rebels entered Beijing.

name: Shenzong (北宋神宗)
description: Northern Song emperor who sponsored Wang Anshi's New Policies, reshaping tax and military systems.

name: Oda Nobunaga (織田信長)
description: Began Japan's military unification and introduced firearms on a large scale.

name: Joseph Stalin
description: General Secretary of the Communist Party, known for his totalitarian regime marked by purges and repression.

name: Rene Descartes
description: Cogito ergo sum; founder of modern rationalist philosophy.

name: Nikola Tesla
description: Serbian-American inventor whose innovations in AC electrical systems transformed modern power distribution.

name: Kim Jong-il
description: Succeeded his father and maintained an oppressive, centralized regime in North Korea.

name: Akbar the Great
description: Mughal emperor who expanded India and promoted religious tolerance and administrative reforms.

name: Heshen (和珅)
description: Infamous favorite of Qianlong; symbol of late-Qing corruption.

name: Mehmed II the Conqueror
description: Captured Constantinople in 1453, ending the Byzantine Empire and reshaping global trade.

name: Emperor Meiji (明治天皇)
description: Under whose reign Japan underwent rapid modernization and emerged as a major world power.

name: Jan Zizka
description: Innovative Hussite general who used wagon-fort tactics to defeat larger crusading armies.

name: Edouard Manet
description: Pioneering French painter bridging Realism and Impressionism with challenging traditional art conventions.

name: Hongwu Emperor (洪武帝)
description: Peasant-turned-emperor who founded the Ming dynasty and reformed land and tax systems.

name: Ferdinand Magellan
description: Initiated the first circumnavigation of the globe, proving global connectivity by sea.

name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
description: A prolific and influential composer of the Classical period with more than 800 works representing virtually every Western classical genre of his time.

name: Kublai Khan (忽必烈汗)
description: Grandson of Genghis; conquered all of China and founded the Yuan dynasty, integrating East-West commerce.

name: Minamoto no Yoritomo (源頼朝)
description: Victorious in the Genpei War; founded the Kamakura shogunate, Japan's first warrior government.

name: Kangxi Emperor (清康熙帝)
description: Consolidated Qing rule and fostered science and culture, becoming one of China's longest-reigning emperors.

name: Johannes Brahms
description: German composer of the Romantic period, recognized for his symphonies, chamber music, and mastery of classical forms.

name: Xu Xiake (徐霞客)
description: Ming geographer whose travel diaries mapped China's karst landscapes and rivers.

name: Pol Pot
description: Leader of the Khmer Rouge, responsible for the Cambodian genocide and radical social engineering.

name: Subutai (速不臺)
description: Genghis Khan's chief strategist; orchestrated campaigns from China to Central Europe.

name: Nicolaus Copernicus
description: Formulated the heliocentric model that overturned Ptolemaic astronomy.

name: Benito Mussolini
description: Founder of Fascism, he ruled Italy with strict authoritarian policies until his downfall during WWII.

name: Christiaan Huygens
description: Formulated the wave theory of light, improved the pendulum clock, and discovered Saturn's rings.

name: Thomas Jefferson
description: Third President of the United States; principal author of the Declaration of Independence.

name: Shi Nai'an (施耐庵)
description: Traditional author of Water Margin, epic of outlaw-heroes in Song China.

name: Edgar Degas
description: French painter and sculptor known for innovative portrayals of movement, particularly in ballet dancers.

name: Evangelista Torricelli
description: Invented the mercury barometer and advanced fluid-dynamics studies.

name: Adelard of Bath
description: Translated Arabic science (Euclid, al-Khwarizmi) and popularised Arabic numerals in Northern Europe.

name: Tokugawa Iemitsu (徳川家光)
description: Third Tokugawa shogun; enforced sakoku isolation and centralized daimyo control.

name: Diego Velazquez
description: Spanish court painter; created the masterpiece Las Meninas.

name: Henry V of England
description: Won the Battle of Agincourt and concluded the Treaty of Troyes during the Hundred Years War.

name: Zuo Zongtang (左宗棠)
description: Military leader and statesman who quelled the Taiping Rebellion and reconsolidated Qing control in the northwest.

name: Abraham Lincoln
description: 16th President of the United States, led the country through the Civil War and issued the Emancipation Proclamation.

name: Philip II Augustus
description: Tripled the royal domain, defeating the Angevin Empire and laying foundations for a centralized French state.

name: John Locke
description: Empiricist philosopher; social-contract theory that influenced Enlightenment politics.

name: Li Chun (李淳)
description: Song engineer who designed the Zhaozhou open-spandrel stone arch bridge, the world's oldest of its type.

name: Batu Khan (拔都汗)
description: Leader of the Golden Horde; devastated Kievan Rus' and invaded Central Europe.

name: Shen Kuo (沈括)
description: Song polymath; Dream Pool Essays described magnetic-declination, movable lock-gates, and astronomy.

name: El Cid (Rodrigo Diaz)
description: Iconic knight-commander of the Reconquista; captured Valencia and became its ruler.

name: Rembrandt van Rijn
description: Dutch Golden-Age painter celebrated for mastery of light and portraiture.

name: Frederic Chopin
description: Polish composer and virtuoso pianist noted for his expressive and technically demanding piano compositions.

name: Suleiman the Magnificent
description: Sultan during the height of Ottoman territorial and cultural power.

name: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
description: Philosopher whose ideas on natural human goodness and social contract influenced revolutionary and democratic thought.

name: Adam Smith
description: A Scottish economist often called The Father of Economics; wrote The Wealth of Nations (1776).

name: Isaac Newton
description: An English polymath active as a mathematician, physicist, and astronomer. Newton was a key figure in the Scientific Revolution and the Enlightenment.

name: Victor Hugo
description: French writer best known for Les Miserables and The Hunchback of Notre-Dame, exploring themes of justice and human suffering.

name: Edmond Halley
description: Predicted the return period of the comet that bears his name; key work in astronomy and geophysics.

name: Dmitri Mendeleev
description: Russian chemist who created the Periodic Table of Elements, predicting properties of undiscovered elements.

name: Moctezuma I
description: Huey Tlatoani who expanded the Aztec Empire and engineered Tenochtitlan's aqueducts.

name: Martin Luther
description: Author of the 95 Theses; catalyst of the Protestant Reformation.

name: James Cook
description: Led three voyages mapping much of the Pacific, including Australia, New Zealand, and Hawaii.

name: Yongzheng Emperor (清雍正帝)
description: Energetic reformer; streamlined taxes and strengthened central control.

name: Henry VIII
description: English monarch who launched the English Reformation and established the Church of England.

name: Murad I
description: Expanded Ottoman rule into the Balkans and won the Battle of Kosovo.

name: Karl Marx
description: Philosopher, economist, and revolutionary whose ideas on socialism and class struggle have influenced global political movements.

name: Marco Polo
description: Travelled to Central Asia and China, documented in The Travels of Marco Polo, greatly influencing European knowledge of the East.

name: Gregor Mendel
description: Austrian scientist whose experiments with pea plants laid the foundation for modern genetics.

name: Robert Hooke
description: Pioneer of cell theory (Micrographia) and author of Hooke's Law of elasticity.

name: Ibn Majid
description: Renowned Arab navigator whose sea-pilot manuals guided Indian-Ocean trade routes.

name: Voltaire
description: French Enlightenment writer and critic of religious intolerance; famous for Candide and his advocacy of civil liberties.

name: Wu Cheng'en (吳承恩)
description: Traditional author of Journey to the West, blending satire, folklore, and Buddhist allegory.

name: Roger Bacon
description: Medieval scholar who championed empirical methods and advanced optics and alchemy.

name: Francisco Franco
description: Military general who ruled Spain with an authoritarian regime following the Spanish Civil War.

name: Albert Einstein
description: A German-born theoretical physicist best known for developing the theory of relativity. He received the 1921 Nobel Prize in Physics.

name: Johannes Kepler
description: Discovered the three laws of planetary motion, laying foundations for celestial mechanics.

name: Frederick the Great
description: King of Prussia; modernized his army and state, making Prussia a major European power.

name: David Hume
description: A Scottish philosopher best known for his highly influential system of empiricism, philosophical scepticism and metaphysical naturalism.

name: Wang Yangming (王陽明)
description: Neo-Confucian philosopher of innate knowing, highly influential in East Asian thought.

name: Pachacuti
description: Transformed the Kingdom of Cusco into the vast Inca Empire and commissioned Machu Picchu.
